A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
If this weren't a Star Wars film\, and a standalone action sci-fi then it would be absolutely fine as a movie for children or pre-teens\, and a decent choice for a Saturday matinee.

However\, it's pitching to a wider audience than that. And so\, I'd have to say that this is terrible. Major plot-holes within the film itself\, and a complete disregard from the Director of the fact that the film is placed within the middle of a trilogy. It doesn't take into account anything of what has happened before\, and leaves no room for anything interesting to happen next.

Star Wars: The Last Jedi is juvenile nonsense.
